( Carnage: Thank you all so very much�for waiting for me. No I am forced to 
make this post quite short in order to keep up with you all. Apperantly I 
need to be quicker...after getting my tonsils out.)

* Dinobot watched as Dark One was sent into a spin from both Tavatron and 
his own charges, a growl of satisfaction trickling from his throat.
He knew that there were more Alliance bots where this one came from, and 
that Dark One wasn�t defeated yet. He continued to watch as Dark One 
transformed into robot mode, waiting for him to fire at him again and give 
him ample reason to attack once again.
Dinobot had had a feeling deep within his gut that this would happen, sooner 
or later. And, it did.
And as injured as he was, he planned to defeat the enemy before he finally 
fell to his knees and gave up.
Dinobot watched the hoe constantly, but he knew just where Tavatron stood, 
just around his blind spot�that just happened to keep growing! He snarled 
angrily, now his systems were beginning to dissolve, beginning with a simple 
fluid pump, and now his sight! That would be his downfall, but lucky enough 
for him it was only one optic and not both.
Yet, still, the enemy would have an even more unfair advantage then they 
already did, they wouldn�t only outnumber them but would be able to shot him 
on his blind side and he wouldn�t even see it coming.
However, luckily, in the past Beast Wars, he had actually learned that sight 
wasn�t everything. And it was also his senses he could rely.
Of course, that was if he didn�t bleed to death first, which he was losing 
mech-fluid now at an alarming rate...because his spark was beating faster 
and pumping fluid faster as well����right out of the hole in his 
chest-plate.
Dinobot sidestepped as a charge from Dark One whizzed past him, his optics 
never leaving the enemy as he did so.
But now, now Tavatron and himself were not alone in their fight towards the 
Alliance, no. Now they had counter attacks, several of them at that. All 
Maximal warriors, come to aid them.
But even as he watched, the plot of this battle shifted�into a duel.
Dinobot watched as both Firearm and Dark One began to pair off, his sight 
decreasing even as he stood there.
A growl rumbling deeply within his voice, knowing that he wished to battle 
instead of standing by and watching others do it.
This wasn�t fair, and he didn�t like it.
But, he had no choice as he walked closer to the two battling bots, watching 
every move, which happened, focusing the best he could with what little 
sight was left in his other optic.
His tail twitched behind him with anticipation, just waiting for a time when 
one made the wrong move and he would have be able to slag the Alliance 
enemy. He waited, crushed that he could no longer battle and was left to 
watch others do so, but he waited.*
